title: How to Make Table Placemats with Leaves

steps.headline: Gather and press leaves at the peak of their color.
Determine the desired size of your placemats.
steps.description: Most placemats are a range of 9x12 inches up to 12x18 inches or so, with the final size left to your discretion.

steps.headline: Cut two sheets of clear contact paper or plastic adhesive film to the size of your desired placemat PLUS one inch extra on each side.
Peel off the paper backing and place the sheet sticky side up on a flat surface.
Place the leaves on the sticky surface in a pleasing pattern.
Peel off the paper backing from your second sheet and carefully "sandwich" the leaves between the two sheets.
Press carefully to ensure good adhesion and remove bubbles.
Cut the excess plastic off around the perimeter of your leaves.

text: Gather and press leaves at the peak of their color.  Determine the desired size of your placemats. Most placemats are a range of 9x12 inches up to 12x18 inches or so, with the final size left to your discretion. Cut two sheets of clear contact paper or plastic adhesive film to the size of your desired placemat PLUS one inch extra on each side.  Peel off the paper backing and place the sheet sticky side up on a flat surface.  Place the leaves on the sticky surface in a pleasing pattern.  Peel off the paper backing from your second sheet and carefully "sandwich" the leaves between the two sheets.  Press carefully to ensure good adhesion and remove bubbles.  Cut the excess plastic off around the perimeter of your leaves.  Enjoy!
